hooks.name: simple_history/log/do_log

doc.description: Filter that makes it possible to shortcut the logging of a message.
doc.long_description: Return bool false to cancel logging .

tags.name: example
tags.content: not log some post types, for example pages and attachments in this case php add_filter( 'simple_history/log/do_log', function ( $do_log = null, $level = null, $message = null, $context = null, $logger = null ) { $post_types_to_not_log = array( 'page', 'attachment', ); if ( ( isset( $logger->slug ) && ( $logger->slug === 'SimplePostLogger' || $logger->slug === 'SimpleMediaLogger' ) ) && ( isset( $context['post_type'] ) && in_array( $context['post_type'], $post_types_to_not_log ) ) ) { $do_log = false; } return $do_log; }, 10, 5 );

tags.name: example
tags.content: all logging php // Disable all logging add_filter( 'simple_history/log/do_log', '__return_false' );

doc.long_description_html: Return bool false to cancel logging .

doc.description: Filter that makes it possible to shortcut this log.
doc.long_description: Return bool false to cancel.
doc.long_description_html: Return bool false to cancel.

doc.description: Easy shortcut method to disable logging of messages from a specific logger.
doc.long_description:
Example filter name: simple_history/log/do_log/SimpleUserLogger simple_history/log/do_log/SimplePostLogger
 Example to disable logging of any user login/logout/failed login activity: add_filter('simple_history/log/do_log/SimpleUserLogger', '__return_false')
doc.long_description_html:
Example filter name: simple_history/log/do_log/SimpleUserLogger simple_history/log/do_log/SimplePostLogger

Example to disable logging of any user login/logout/failed login activity: add_filter('simple_history/log/do_log/SimpleUserLogger', '__return_false')

hooks.name: simple_history/log_html_output_details_table/context_keys_to_show

doc.description: Filter what keys to show from the row context.
doc.long_description:
Array is in format:
 ```   Array   (       [plugin_slug] => 1       [plugin_name] => 1       [plugin_title] => 1       [plugin_description] => 1       [plugin_author] => 1       [plugin_version] => 1       ...   ) ```

tags.name: example
tags.content: some more columns from the detailed context view popup window php add_filter( 'simple_history/log_html_output_details_table/context_keys_to_show', function ( $logRowContextKeysToShow, $oneLogRow ) { $logRowContextKeysToShow['plugin_slug'] = false; $logRowContextKeysToShow['plugin_name'] = false; $logRowContextKeysToShow['plugin_title'] = false; $logRowContextKeysToShow['plugin_description'] = false; return $logRowContextKeysToShow; }, 10, 2 );

tags.name: param
tags.content: with keys to show. key to show = key. value = boolean to show or not.

tags.name: param
tags.content: log row to show details from

doc.long_description_html:
Array is in format:

  Array
  (
      [plugin_slug] => 1
      [plugin_name] => 1
      [plugin_title] => 1
      [plugin_description] => 1
      [plugin_author] => 1
      [plugin_version] => 1
      ...
  )

hooks.name: simple_history/log_insert_context

doc.description: Filters the context to store for this event/row

tags.name: example
tags.content: adding things to the context table during logging. Useful if you don't want to add cool and possible super useful info to your logged events. Also nice to have if you want to make sure your database does not grow. php add_filter( 'simple_history/log_insert_context', function ( $context, $data ) { unset( $context['_user_id'] ); unset( $context['_user_login'] ); unset( $context['_user_email'] ); unset( $context['server_http_user_agent'] ); return $context; }, 10, 2 );

tags.name: param
tags.content: Array with all context data to store. Modify and return this.

tags.name: param
tags.content: Array with data used for parent row.

doc.description: Filter the context to store for this event/row

tags.content: Array with data used for parent row.

hooks.name: simple_history/logger/interpolate/context

doc.description: Filters the context used to create the message from the message template.
doc.long_description: Can be used to modify the variables sent to the message template.

tags.name: example
tags.content: that modifies the parameters sent to the message template. This example will change the post type from "post" or "page" or similar to "my own page type". php add_filter( 'simple_history/logger/interpolate/context', function ( $context, $message, $row ) { if ( empty( $row ) ) { return $context; } if ( $row->logger == 'SimplePostLogger' && $row->context_message_key == 'post_updated' ) { $context['post_type'] = 'my own page type'; } return $context; }, 10, 3 );

tags.name: param
tags.content: The row. Not supported by all loggers.

doc.long_description_html: Can be used to modify the variables sent to the message template.

hooks.name: simple_history/loggers_user_can_read/can_read_single_logger

doc.description: Filters who can read/view the messages from a single logger.

tags.name: example
tags.content: who can read a logger. php // Modify who can read a logger. // Modify the if part to give users access or no access to a logger. add_filter( 'simple_history/loggers_user_can_read/can_read_single_logger', function ( $user_can_read_logger, $logger_instance, $user_id ) { // in this example user with id 3 gets access to the post logger // while user with id 8 does not get any access to it if ( $logger_instance->slug == 'SimplePostLogger' && $user_id === 3 ) { $user_can_read_logger = true; } elseif ( $logger_instance->slug == 'SimplePostLogger' && $user_id === 9 ) { $user_can_read_logger = false; } return $user_can_read_logger; }, 10, 3 );

tags.name: param
tags.content: Whether the user is allowed to view the logger.

hooks.name: simple_history/user_can_clear_log

doc.description: Allows controlling who can manually clear the log.
doc.long_description: When this is true then the "Clear"-button in shown in the settings. When this is false then no button is shown.

tags.name: example
tags.content: // Remove the "Clear log"-button, so a user with admin access can not clear the log  // and wipe their mischievous behavior from the log.  add_filter(      'simple_history/user_can_clear_log',      function ( $user_can_clear_log ) {          $user_can_clear_log = false;          return $user_can_clear_log;      }  ); ```

tags.name: param
tags.content: Whether the current user is allowed to clear the log.

doc.long_description_html: When this is true then the "Clear"-button in shown in the settings. When this is false then no button is shown.

hooks.name: simple_history/view_history_capability

doc.description: Filter the capability required to view main simple history page, with the activity feed.
doc.long_description: Default capability is "edit_pages".

tags.name: example
tags.content: the capability required to view the log to "manage options", so only allow admins are allowed to view the history log page. php add_filter( 'simple_history/view_history_capability', function ( $capability ) { $capability = 'manage_options'; return $capability; } );

doc.long_description_html: Default capability is "edit_pages".
